Post_Text: Adrian Hill director of Oxford University's Jenner Institute and the co-creator of the AstraZeneca-Oxford COVID-19 vaccine that has been newly approved for use in Canada tells Power & Politics the vaccine has shown that it can prevent severe illness.

We are hosting two free virtual one-hour discussions about the COVID-19 vaccine and how it affects Indigenous and multicultural communities. ⁠⁠Head to cbc.ca/ourshot to register for one of the following conversations on Wednesday March 3:⁠⁠4:30 p.m. – Community Conversation: COVID-19 vaccines and Indigenous communities.⁠⁠CBC Vancouver's Angela Sterritt and Dr. Shannon McDonald Acting Chief Medical Officer First Nations Health Authority for a discussion about the cultural and geographical considerations of COVID-19 vaccine distribution in B.C.'s Indigenous communities. ⁠⁠6:00 p.m. – Community Conversation: COVID-19 vaccines and multicultural communities⁠⁠CBC Vancouver's Anita Bathe for a discussion about the COVID-19 vaccine and effective rollout and communication in B.C.'s multicultural communities.
